results.title: Amelie Ou le Temps D'aimer = Amelia or Time for Love
results.brief_description:
At the end of the 19th century, an orphan girl living near the Mont Saint-Michel island is secretly in love with her cousin Alain. Alain has two passions: the sea and Amelie’s Parisian cousin, Fanny. Realising that her secret love may never be repaid, Amelie slowly loses the will to live.

Credits: Producer, Mina Berard ; director, Michel Drach ; writer, Michel Drach ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Jean-Sebastien Bach.
Cast: Marie-Jose Nat, Jean Sorel, Clotilde Joano, Roger Van Mullem, Jean Babilee, Sophie Daumier, Louise de Vilmorin.

results.title: Entree des Artistes = the Curtain Rises
results.brief_description:
Entree des Artistes’ details the lives and loves of several students at the Paris Conservatory of Drama. Wealthy student Cecilia is in love with fellow student Francois and jealous of his relationship with poor student Isabelle. Cecilia successfully plots to break-up the relationship. As the end of the presentation approaches, Cecilia decides to play the part of a woman who dies of poisoning. Of particular interest in this film is the ‘real-life’ scene in which Louis Jouvet plays his own role as a teacher at the Paris Drama School rehearsing young actor Bernard Blier.

Credits: Producer, Georges Jouanne ; director, Marc Allegret ; writers, Henri Jeanson, Andre Cayatte ; photography, Christian Matras, Robert Juillard ; music, Georges Auric ; art direction, Jacques Krauss, Alexandre Trauner.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Janine Darcey, Claude Dauphin, Odette Joyeux, Andre Brunot, Mady Made, Julien Carette, Marcel Dalio, Sylvie, Roger Blin, Bernard Blier, Michel Vitold.

results.title: Rive Droite, Rive Gauche = Right Bank, Left Bank
results.brief_description:
For the love of Sacha, a Left Bank public relations manager, Paul Senanques, a Right Bank business counsel provokes a political scandal by exposing his biggest client, Pervillard, as an unscrupulous business man. Now Paul and Sacha must contend with the wrath of Pervillard and Paul’s wife.

Credits: Producer, Alain Terzian ; director, Philippe Labro ; writers, Philippe Labro, Francoise Labro ; photography, Pascal Marti ; music, Michel Berger.
Cast: Gerard Depardieu, Nathalie Baye, Carole Bouquet, Bernard Fresson, Charlotte de Turckheim, Jacques Weber.

results.title: Le Sucre = the Sugar
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rouffio, Georgio Silvagni and Lise Fayolle
results.brief_description:
Adrien, a wealthy retiree, meets Raoul, a hot-shot commodities broker who sweet talks him into speculating on the recent rise in sugar prices. Grezillo, the “sugar king” is using the rumour mill to create panic buying of sugar and maintain the prices at high level. Adrien sees his capital double in value and decides to use Raoul’s scheme again. But the market turns around …

Credits: Producers, Georgio Silvagni, Lise Fayolle ; director, Jacques Rouffio ; writers, Georges Conchon, Jacques Rouffio ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Gerard Depardieu, Jean Carmet, Michel Piccoli, Nelly Borgeaud, Roger Hanin, Marthe Villalonga, Claude Pieplu, Georges Descrieres, Jean-Paul Muel, Toni Taffin.

results.title: Il Etait Une Fois le Cap Horn = One Upon a Time Cape Horn
results.brief_description: This corporate documentary follows French yachtsman Alain Colas, from the launch of his boat in St Malo to his successful completion of a solo round-the-world journey via Cape Horn.
results.title_for_label: Il Etait Une Fois le Cap Horn = One Upon a Time Cape Horn
results.description: This corporate documentary follows French yachtsman Alain Colas, from the launch of his boat in St Malo to his successful completion of a solo round-the-world journey via Cape Horn.

results.title: Chiens Perdus Sans Collier = Lost Dogs Without Collar
results.brief_description:
Judge Lamy is presiding the Juvenile Court. Under a rough outlook, he is hiding a deep sense of compassion for all the young peole in trouble he tries to help. One day, the young Alain-Robert is brought before him, charged with setting fire to his employer’s farm as a revenge for all the beatings he received. Later on, Francis, gets caught stealing in the changing rooms of a football club.

Credits: Director, Jean Delannoy ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost, Francois Boyer ; photography, Pierre Montazel ; music, Paul Misraki.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Anne Doat, Serge Lecointe, Jacques Moulieres, Dora Doll, Jane Marken.

results.title: L'associe = the Associate
results.brief_description:
Julien Pardot, a rather dull corporate executive invents an ‘assistant’, the dynamic, go-getting ‘Mr. Davis’ on whom all the important decisions depend. Pretending to be Mr. Davis’ intermediary, Pardot at last makes it big in the business world. A crisis develops when Pardot’s investors demand to meet Mr. Davis in person—and when several young ladies show up, claiming to be the mothers of Mr. Davis’ children. Re-made as ‘The Associate’ (1996), with Whoopie Goldberg. Both are a re-makes of the 1939 film ‘The Mysterious Mr. Davis’ directed by Claude Autant-Lara with a cast of British actors, including Alastair Sim.

Credits: Producer, Simone Allouche ; director, Rene Gainville ; writers, Rene Gainville, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Etienne Szabo ; music, Michel Bernholc, Mort Schuman.
Cast: Michel Serrault, Claudine Auger, Catherine Alric, Judith Magre, Henri Virlojeux, Mathieu Carriere.

results.title: Un officier de police sans importance = A police officer without importance
results.creator_credit: Jean Larriaga, Daniel Moosmann and Philippe Ogouz
results.brief_description:
In order to help free his brother from jail, Pierre organises the kidnapping of a police officer to serve as hostage and bargaining chip.

Credits: Producer, Daniel Moosman, Philippe Ogouz ; director, Jean Larriaga ; writers, Jean Larriaga, Marc Porel ; photography, Roland Dantigny ; music, Laurent Petitgirard.
Cast: Marc Porel, Robert Hossein, Jean Negulesco, Dani, Charles Denner.

results.title: L'acrobate = the Acrobat
results.creator_credit: Jean-Daniel Pollet, Ilios Films and Les Films du Chef-Lieu
results.brief_description:
Leon, an often bullied bathhouse attendant, is too timid to get a date and must often share his nights and dreams with the local working girls. He is truly in love with one of them and does not quite know how to declare his passion. Leon decides to take up tango lesson. As Leon’s footwork improves on the dance floor, so does his ability to approach women. Awards: Prix de la Critique. Festival du Film d’Humour, Chamrousse 1976

Credits: Director, Jean-Daniel Pollet ; writers, Jean-Daniel Pollet, Jacques Lourcelles.
Cast: Claude Melki, Guy Marchand, Marion Game, Micheline Dax, Laurence Bru, Edith Scob.

results.title: La Sentence = the Sentence
results.brief_description:
In September 1944, four resistance fighters and a fisherman are captured by German soldiers after a failed grenade attack. They are taken to the basement of a deserted house while awaiting their fate. They are to be executed in the morning.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Jean Valere ; writers, Georges-Jan Arnaud, Marcel Moussy, Jean Valere ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Daniel Lesur ; art direction, Bernard Evein, Jacques Saulnier.
Cast: Robert Hossein, Marina Vlady, Roger Hanin, Beatrice Bretty, Lucien Raimbourg.
